intro: Meibomia neurocarpa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are adapted for pollination by insects. Meibomia neurocarpa is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its role in traditional medicine in its native regions.
